Parser

class words.parser.parse.Parser

The Parser class is used to for parsing lexer tokens into a program the interpreter can interpret.

static parse(tokens: Iterator[LexerToken]) → Program

Parse an iterator of lexer tokens into a program.

During the parsing step the simple lexer tokens are expanded with more information gotten from their context.

Parameters

tokens – An iterator over lexer tokens to parse.

Returns

A program.

Parse Utils

class words.parser.parse_util.Program(tokens: List[ParserToken])

A collection of parser tokens that can be interpreted or compiled.

words.parser.parse_util.eat_until(tokens: Iterator[LexerToken], limit_types: List[TokenTypeEnum]) → List[Union[LexerToken, ParserToken]]

Parse tokens until the next token matches the limit_type, leaving the last token unparsed.

Parameters

  • tokens – The tokens to parse.

  • limit_types – The types of tokens to stop parsing at.

Returns

List of parser tokens and an unparsed lexer token at the end.

words.parser.parse_util.eat_until_discarding(tokens: Iterator[LexerToken], limit_types: List[TokenTypeEnum]) → List[ParserToken]

Parse tokens until the next token matches the limit_type, discarding the last token.

Parameters

  • tokens – The tokens to parse.

  • limit_types – The types of tokens to stop parsing at.

Returns

List of parser tokens.
